metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15393 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 4.4 through 5.7.6, usbtest_disconnect indrivers/usb/misc/usbtest.c has a memory leak, aka CID-28ebeb8db770.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-187.217
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1078.85
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1112.124
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1137-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1137.146
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1141-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1141.149
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-187.217').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.85').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1112.124').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1137.146').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1141.149').
